content.description: Start on the jug at the far right end of the big sloping rail feature.  Climb left along the entire rail to the start of Saddlehorn and climb that problem.
content.location: right side of the sloping rail feature

content.description: Start on a right hand sloping side pull edge and a opposing left in the crack on the overhanging face (just to the left of the long rail).  Climb straight up to the "horn" jug feature. Continue up to the lip and mantle.
content.location: left of the long sloping rail feature

content.description: Start on a high jug on the left side of the long sloping rail feature. Make the huge crux move up and left to a right facing hold in the crack.  Make another move to the "horn" jug feature and prepare to make another huge heady move up to the lip. Mantle out and over the bulge or exit right to make it a little easier.
content.location: south face of the bigger boulder

content.description: Start on the left jug on the big sloping rail at head height.  Traverse right to the jug at the right end of the rail.  Make a big move into the start of Saddlebag and finish it.
content.location: Start on the left jug on the long rail

content.description: Start on a left crimp and a sidepull in the vertical crack on the arete (to the right of the last jug on the rail).  Make a big move up to the jug.  make another big move straight up to two crappy holds on the sloping top and finish it up. (crux)
content.location: to the right of the long sloping rail at head height

content.description: Start on the jug on the far left of the long rail.  Get high feet and make a long reach into the thin crack leading up and right (crux).  Continue moving right in that crack till you are standing on the right side of the long rail.  Grab two descent crimps and move up making the heady move to the top.

Start with your right hand on the far right hold in the crack at 6' and your felt on a low crimp. Climb left along the horizontal crack and a big lunge (crux) to a jug in the notch at the top.  Vertical crack and all holds to the right are off. Be careful making the lunge because you are climbing over a rock that is hard to protect.
content.location: small boulder on the north side of the main Saddle Boulder

content.description: Start on two good holds in a crack a 6'. Climb up using good holds in an angling crack to good holds and mantle.
content.location: on a small boulder north of the main face of the Saddle Boulder

content.description: Start on the jug on the right side of the long rail.  Make a huge lunge to a flat sharp hold.  Continue up to the top and mantle out.

On the south overhanging face you will see two vertical flairing seams. Start on holds in the seam at around 5'.  Climb up the overhang making desperate and difficult moves to the crux.  Throw for the bad slope below a sharp jug.  Continue up another 10' on better holds to an scary airy top.
content.protection: pads, a spotter, and solid nerves.
content.location: south overhanging face of Saddle Boulder

content.description: This is a short persons problem SS on a low sloping hold. Make a tough lock off to a good lip (crux). Make a couple more moves on good holds and top-out.
content.protection: pad only cause you are climbing over a rock
content.location: North side of small boulder next to the main Saddle Boulder

content.description: In the saddle of the 2 small mountains you will find a 25' boulder with a big sloping rail at 5' running the length of the main face.
